greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of {1,2,...,3n} into 3 n-element subsets having the same sum.
comment: The element sum of each subset is n*(3*n+1)/2 = A005449(n).
example: a(1) = 0: there is no partition of {1,2,3} into 3 1-element subsets having the same sum.
maple: b:= proc() option remember; local i, j, t, k, m; m:= args[nargs-1]; k:= args[nargs-0]; if args[1]=0 then `if`(nargs=3, 1, b(args[t]$t=2..nargs)) elif args[1]<1 then 0 else add(`if`(args[j]<m, 0, b(sort([seq(args[i] -`if`(i=j, m+1/97, 0), i=1..nargs-2)])[], m-1, k)), j=1..nargs-2) fi end:
mathematica: b[args_] := b[args] = Module[{nargs = Length[args], k = args[[-1]], m = args[[-2]]}, Which[args[[1]] == 0, If[nargs == 3, 1, b[args[[2 ;; nargs]] ]], args[[1]]<1, 0, True, Sum[If[args[[j]] < m, 0, b[Join[Sort[Table[ args[[i]] - If[i == j, m + 1/97, 0], {i, 1, nargs - 2}]], {m - 1, k}]]], {j, 1, nargs-2}]]];
a /@ Range[0, 10] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 05 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 06 2012
